summary: This is an email exchange between the FBI's New York Field Office and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding the Epstein case. The FBI confirms they have assigned two people to read the file and will provide 302s (FBI interview reports), while the SDNY requests a joint meeting to discuss operational steps.

persons.name: Assistant Special Agent in Charge
persons.role: FBI Assistant Special Agent in Charge
persons.context: Author of the email response from the FBI's New York Field Office, confirming assignment of personnel to review the Epstein file and promising to provide 302s.

persons.name: Chief Public Corruption Unit
persons.role: Chief of the Public Corruption Unit at the U.S. Attorney's Office
persons.context: Author of the initial email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, requesting a joint meeting to discuss operational steps and asking for FBI 302s related to the Epstein case.

connections.description: Corresponding about coordinating investigation efforts and sharing FBI 302 reports regarding the Epstein case.

events.title: Email coordination on Epstein investigation
events.description: Email exchange between FBI New York Field Office and SDNY Public Corruption Unit regarding operational planning and document sharing for the Epstein investigation.

locations: United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The FBI assigned two people to read the Epstein file as of December 2018.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively involved in operational planning for the Epstein investigation.
FBI 302s (interview reports) were being requested and promised to be shared between agencies.
The email shows inter-agency coordination between the FBI and SDNY on the Epstein case.
